alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 24 at 2:11PM PDT until March 29 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet along the Sierra crest with 10 to 20 inches possible in Mammoth Lakes, June Lakes and across higher passes of Highway 395. Elsewhere, total accumulations of 2 to 6 inches are possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph in wind prone locations along Highway 395 and up to 100 mph along Sierra ridges. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...From Monday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring blowing and drifting snow with greatly reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The highest snowfall rates and strongest winds are anticipated from Tuesday into Tuesday night. Snow showers to continue into Wednesday with periods of locally intense snowfall.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
